Reviewed 11 of 11 files at r1. Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 12 unresolved discussions, some commit checks broke. --- *[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.cc, line 962 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L7jDlKIy2uxn0hZd8Kx-r1-962:-L7jF8mYSeP-qKgyuadW:bv04sju) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d5a83afeb6404373c7d3f3a8e7a7116cd98d2cf9/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.cc#L962)):*
Previously, jiangtaoli2016 (Jiangtao Li) wroteâ€¦
@markdroth wants to destroy it explicitly.
Yes. There are cases where we call `grpc_shutdown()` and then call `grpc_init()` again (usually in tests, but there may also be cases where an application could do that too). --- *[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.cc, line 962 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L7jFLAmgMrtoqYwzojy:-L7jFLAmgMrtoqYwzojz:b-8sgwvd) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d5a83afeb6404373c7d3f3a8e7a7116cd98d2cf9/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.cc#L962)):* > ```cpp > > static grpc_slice default_pem_root_certs; > static ssl_root_certs_store* default_root_store = nullptr; > ``` The convention in C-core is that global variables start with the prefix `g_`. --- *[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h, line 217 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L7jEn6E5E1DzUgu76VG:-L7jEn6E5E1DzUgu76VH:b-npw6sc) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d5a83afeb6404373c7d3f3a8e7a7116cd98d2cf9/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h#L217)):* > ```objc > const char* overridden_target_name, grpc_channel_security_connector** sc); > > /* Gets the default ssl root store. Returns nullptr if not found. */ > ``` Any reason not to build this as a C++ API, so that we have one fewer thing to convert to C++ later? --- *[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h, line 218 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L7jETygzfR4xtEhZOnw:-L7jETygzfR4xtEhZOnx:bqkvg5p) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d5a83afeb6404373c7d3f3a8e7a7116cd98d2cf9/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h#L218)):* > ```objc > > /* Gets the default ssl root store. Returns nullptr if not found. */ > const ssl_root_certs_store* grpc_get_default_ssl_root_store(void); > ``` Please call this `grpc_ssl_default_root_store_get()`. --- *[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h, line 221 at r1](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L7jEXh15lltJ01rPFqr:-L7jEXh15lltJ01rPFqs:bk0to1) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/d5a83afeb6404373c7d3f3a8e7a7116cd98d2cf9/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h#L221)):* > ```objc > > /* Destroys the default ssl root store. */ > void grpc_destroy_default_ssl_root_store(void); > ``` Please call this `grpc_ssl_default_root_store_destroy()`. --- *Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722)*

Code revised and all comments addressed. 
I will wait https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/14483 to merge first, then I will resolve the conflict.
We cannot share X509_STORE before openssl 1.1. I guess for users of older version of OpenSSL, we have to load all root certs each time tsi_client_handshaker_factory is created.

Reviewed 8 of 8 files at r2.
Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 9 unresolved discussions, some commit checks broke.

---

*[src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h, line 258 at r2](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/grpc/grpc/14722#-L87zL6Z0JVo4l0O2-sg:-L87zL6Z0JVo4l0O2-sh:bhkybpd) ([raw file](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/2138bf5562700b31911a0a7df6ff1d206f598f6c/src/core/lib/security/security_connector/security_connector.h#L258)):*
> ```objc
>   static void DestroyRootStore();
> 
>   // Exposed for TESTING ONLY!
> ```

I don't see this actually being used in a test anywhere.

If we do need this in a test, how about making the test fixture a friend instead?

---

Code revised. Please take a look.

OpenSSL 1.0x or prior version does not have good support of sharing X509_STORE. **Thus root_cert passed to tsi_create_ssl_client_handshaker_factory is used only if it not nullptr and OpenSSL version permits**. Think of root_cert as an optional perf improvement. Passing root certificate through pem_root_certs always works for backward compatibility and for supporting user customized root certs.

```
